intro: Tetraplasandra kaalae var. multiplex, commonly known as the Hawaiian treefern, is a unique species native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, feathery fronds that give it a distinctive fern-like appearance. The plant belongs to the Cyatheaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. It has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 15 meters in optimal conditions. Due to its restricted habitat and conservation status, it is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
